intro: Orthosiphon grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered horsegram, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite leaves and spikes of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It is often found in moist, tropical environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
